data.title: Manage middle click in Tabs / Close scene if middle click on scene tab
data.body:
- Added new signal in Tabs : middle_button_pressed. 
- Added corresponding behaviour in editors Scene tabs to close scene on middle click.
- Managed confirmation question on closing a non-saved scene.

Note : tabs.cpp _input_event() is now opened for different calls depending on the mouse button pressed.

data.title: Cannot overwrite tilesets after saving over them.
data.body: For some reason if you save over an existing tileset Godot remembers the previous one in its cache if it had the same name. This requires you to save a completely unique tileset every time that you want to make a change to it.

data.title: Haiku: platform support
data.body:
Hello.

I have been working on platform support for the Haiku operating system.
This pull request adds support for the editor, platform support for keyboard, mice and sound (using the media kit API).

At the moment there is no export functionality.
Most of the code is in `platform/haiku` and `drivers/media_kit`.

I had to make it link dynamically with `libglew` because this library has a native port for Haiku and I could not make the one included in the source compile.

There are also three ifdefs to make it use `<fcntl.h>` instead of `<sys/fcntl.h>`.
I think the POSIX one is `<fcntl.h>` and Haiku uses it. Maybe `<sys/fcntl.h>` is a linuxism, I am not sure as I do not have that much knowledge in this area.

Feedback is welcome :)

data.title: get_date on Linux
data.body: tm_mon is 0-11

data.title: Some TextEdit selection improvements
data.body:
One of the improvements is that it allows using pointer and shift selection together. Scrolling with mouse wheel does not longer end the selection process (closes #1190)

Changed the way shift+click selection works when changing from forward to backwards (and vice versa). It works similarly to shift selection (this is how most editors work).

[This video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qn5Lu8t498I) shows the main differences (before,  after).

data.title: [TileMap-Feature] - Load scene as tileset
data.body: load tileset directly from .scn: Creating a TileSet on each update of the scene is annoying, so i made a new Property to load the scene dircetly in a TileMap.

data.title: Fixed 'osx' and 'iphone' compilation error on MacOSX 10.10 and HTML5 export
data.body:
Removed call to 'localtime' in OS_Unix::get_system_time_msec, which caused the following compiler error when building:

```
sudo scons -j4 platform=osx
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
sh: i586-mingw32msvc-gcc: command not found
sh: x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc: command not found
sh: i686-w64-mingw32-gcc: command not found
scons: done reading SConscript files.
scons: Building targets ...
g++ -o drivers/unix/os_unix.osx.tools.32.o -c -g3 -Wall -DDEBUG_ENABLED - DDEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -arch i386 -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC -DSCI_NAMESPACE -DAPPLE_STYLE_KEYS -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLEW_ENABLED -DOSX_ENABLED -DMUSEPACK_ENABLED -DSQUISH_ENABLED -DVORBIS_ENABLED -DTHEORA_ENABLED -DPNG_ENABLED -DDDS_ENABLED -DPVR_ENABLED -DJPG_ENABLED -DWEBP_ENABLED -DSPEEX_ENABLED -DTOOLS_ENABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -DETC1_ENABLED -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/osx -Itools/freetype -Itools/freetype/freetype/include -Idrivers/unix/vorbis drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp
drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp:229:2: error: no matching function for call to 'localtime'
    localtime(&tv_now.tv_usec);
        ^~~~~~~~~
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.10.sdk/usr/include/time.h:112:12: note: 
  candidate function not viable: no known conversion from '__darwin_suseconds_t *' (aka 'int *') to 'const time_t *'
  (aka 'const long *') for 1st argument
struct tm *localtime(const time_t *);
           ^
1 error generated.
scons: *** [drivers/unix/os_unix.osx.tools.32.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

data.title: SIMD optimization for AABB::intersects_segment
data.body:
"AABB::intersects_segment" is optimized with Intel SSE instructions and runs ~2X as fast as the original.

Running:
valgrind --tool=callgrind --toggle-collect=TestAABB::test_aabb\* --cache-sim=yes --branch-sim=yes ./bin/godot.x11.64 -test aabb

then:
kcachegrind callgrind.out.*

Normal binary output shows a cycle estimation of 971474:
![KCachegrind AABB No SIMD](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12058304/9157410/0a159de4-3eb1-11e5-8e0e-ee12cefd18b2.png)

SIMD optimized binary shows a cycle estimation of 515142:

![KCachegrind AABB SIMD](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12058304/9157365/b08a69fe-3eaf-11e5-913a-e0c420ead69d.png)

NOTE: Only optimized for GCC, Intel SSE, and single precision floating point!  It will compile on other platforms but won't be optimized.

data.title: Editor autosaves over filesystem changes when playing
data.body:
If I work in an external editor, then switch back to Godot, the "Please Confirm..." files changed dialog appears.  However, it is possible to click "play" with the dialog box still open, which will cause the editor to play the project, saving all of the old versions of the files over the externally changed versions.

The "Please Confirm..." dialog should probably not allow any other interaction with the editor until the situation has been resolved.

data.title: Hide right UR and BR dock slots by default
data.body:
Unlike _left_ UpLeft and BottomLeft dock slots, _right_ UpRight and BottomRight slots was not hidden by default, causing one not to fill vertically if the other one is empty.

Since there was no issue about this problem, here is an screenshot:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/9156757/63c9419a-3ee5-11e5-9367-6394ba6d9c3b.png)

data.title: Fedora 22: "Package 'xext', required by 'xinerama', not found" when compiling
data.body:
I get the following error when running `scons platform=x11`

```
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
sh: i586-mingw32msvc-gcc: command not found
sh: x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc: command not found
sh: i686-w64-mingw32-gcc: command not found
Package xext was not found in the pkg-config search path.
Perhaps you should add the directory containing `xext.pc'
to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
Package 'xext', required by 'xinerama', not found
OSError: 'pkg-config xinerama --cflags --libs' exited 1:
  File "/data/thecodethinker/godot/SConstruct", line 223:
    detect.configure(env)
  File "./platform/x11/detect.py", line 127:
    env.ParseConfig('pkg-config xinerama --cflags --libs')
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Environment.py", line 1579:
    return function(self, self.backtick(command))
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Environment.py", line 597:
    raise OSError("'%s' exited %d" % (command, status))
```

I've tried adding the xext.pc path to `PKG_CONFIG_PATH` but it doesn't change the error.

Any ideas?

data.title: BBCode is now allowed anywhere in the inline documentation.
data.body: Previously, the inline help would not accept BBCode in places like the signal descriptions. Now, any string coming from the XML is assumed to be both BBCode and inline (does not generate a new block of text, nor does it change the formatting).
